snippet: Iran issued new objections to Turkey as the formerly agreed location for the talks and revealed it had rejected alternate proposals to hold them in at least three European countries.
abstract: Iran issues new objections to Turkey as the formerly agreed location for the scheduled resumption of talks on Iran's contentious nuclear program and reveals it had rejected alternate proposals to hold them in at least three European countries.

byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu contributed reporting from Istanbul, Artin Afkhami from Boston and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Iran issued new objections to Turkey as the formerly agreed location for the talks and revealed it had rejected alternate proposals to hold them in at least three European countries.

headline.main: Doubts Intensify on Resumption of Iran Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: Iran: New Doubts on Nuclear Talks
